name: Manic Game Girl
description:
University student Amber just thought she was buying a new video game, but everything changes when she discovers her brand new Game Stealth is able to turn her into a superhero. Soon she finds herself fighting petty crime and taking down an evil game company while still making time for classes and anime club.

Manic Game Girl is a comedic action/adventure game with a heavy story focus and a large amount of space to explore. Combat is based around Amber's Game Stealth suit, which she can activate when enemies are nearby. Combat plays like a 3D beat-em-up with relatively simple controls; there are two attack buttons, a punch and a kick, and combos are based on repeatedly tapping attack buttons. She also has a throw when near enemies.

shot.caption: Title screen
The intro video opens with Amber, the protagonist, on a lonely winter day.
Stopping in front of a game store, she notices the new Game Stealth being advertised.
The in-game introduction opens with a board meeting at Gecko Enterprise, about to test their new product.
Another executive comes by with the prototype.
This looks suspiciously like a Game Boy...
The game-within-a-game is a ninja-themed beat-em-up.
The posters in the back suggest something very tokusatsu-themed is going to happen.
We meet Amber, our hero, as she's sitting in her dorm room.
Taking a detour in a weirdly cavernous library on the way to class.
Amber's really not looking too enthusiastic about class today.
Amber can collect items she finds on the ground; some give her money or health, while others go into her inventory for later use. Who left this game cartridge lying around?
This guy looks extremely into anime.
Amber's dorm is multi-level, and there's an elevator to get around.
Amber and her roommate decide to try out the anime club, and they're immediately hooked.
Anime club made a big impression, so they head straight to the game store after.
There's actually a whole lot of game covers,a nd even some faux consoles!
The shop clerk gives you a choice between a Spartan 128, a Jet Stream 64, and a Skypass 128. The player can pick whichever; the difference is cosmetic.
All right! Video games!
That's... probably not good.
Amber wakes up next to this nurse, who hands her a Game Stealth.
As soon as she takes hold of it... she transforms! Whenever she's in this tokusatsu-inspired form she can attack.
Now that she has a Game Stealth, Amber can access the in-game menu. The player saves their game using it.
The mirror actually has reflections!
Amber's next mission is to go buy DVDs for anime club from Power Records.
There's a news report of some kind on the TV.
The most difficult choice in the entire game: buy anime dubbed, subbed, or raw?
While in the shop Amber gets a dispatch on her Game Stealth...
...and transforms to get ready for battle!
While transformed, Amber can combo together various punches and kicks.
